title: A Savvy Shopper’s Guide to Dublin
text:
Knit Pick

Every Irish child is swathed at some stage in a thick, nubby-knit Aran sweater, likely made by an enthusiastic granny. The fisherman’s sweaters, which originated on Ireland’s Aran Islands 100-plus years ago, get an extra-sculptural spin at the hands of designer Colin Burke. Available at department store Brown Thomas until December. About $1,100, 88-95 Grafton Street, brownthomas.com

Tipple Crown

Pick up a bottle of Teeling Whiskey at the venerable family-owned brand’s distillery. A tour of the facility schools...
description: From a locally loved whiskey to a high-design fisherman’s sweater, four souvenirs to seek out.
